tool_description:
Cloud texting for toll free,
landline,
and mobile numbers
Send and receive text messages
from your laptop, desktop, or
tablet computer using your
existing mobile or landline
phone number.
name: Zipwhip
title: Zipwhip

api_list.name: user/save
api_list.description: Save details about the user associated with the provided session

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: group/save
api_list.description: Create a group. A named group is a unique set of contacts that are referenced similar to a contact  A group is defined as device:/xxxxxxxxxx/xx. After the :/, this is the phone number associated with the account you are sending messages under. The /xx is the id for the group.

required_parameters.name: name
required_parameters.description: This is the name of the group that you would like to associate with a group of contacts when using group/save.

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: This is used to identify the type of group you wish to create. For now, please use 'Group'

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: textline
optional_parameters.description: If the group is being created within a landline or toll-free number than this parameter is required. This is the routing information for sending out the group message. Example format textline:/xxxxxxxxxx?carrier=xxx. After the :/ this is the logged in number's phone number. The carrier is equal to the carrier returned from user/get.

api_list.name: group/addmember
api_list.description: Once a group is created via the group/save call, you then need to populate members.

required_parameters.name: address
required_parameters.description: For US domestic use 10-digit number. For International numbers use full E.164 format. Examples: US: 5555555555 E.164: +1155555555555

required_parameters.name: group
required_parameters.description: The address that identifies the group in the logged in account. Format will be similar to: device:/xxxxxxxxxx/xx.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: city
optional_parameters.description: The name city where the contact resides.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email address of the contact being saved.

optional_parameters.name: firstName
optional_parameters.description: The first name of the contact being saved.

optional_parameters.name: lastName
optional_parameters.description: The last name of the contact being saved.

optional_parameters.name: loc
optional_parameters.description: Notes about the contact, limit 255 characters.

optional_parameters.name: notes
optional_parameters.description: Notes about the contact, limit 255 characters.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: The state where the contact resides.

api_list.name: message/delete
api_list.description: Marks the given message as deleted in Zipwhip's database.

required_parameters.name: message
required_parameters.description: The message ID being modified. In all cases the method will take multiple messages as parameters.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: contact/delete
api_list.description: This method can take one or more contact ID(s) and delete those records from Zipwhip. A contact's ID is available from contact/list or part of the return from message/send.

required_parameters.name: contact
required_parameters.description: This is the contact ID that is return from contact/list. A contact ID is also part of the return from message/send.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: message/list
api_list.description: Retrieves messages for account. A start of 0 provides newest to oldest messages.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of elements returned when paging.

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description: When paging through content, this field is used to tell the controller what element to start at for the next page.

api_list.name: * user/login
api_list.description: Takes a username and password and returns json with the account's session key. A sessionkey lasts forever, so it is best to store the sessionkey and use it for future purposes.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: For US domestic use 10-digit number. For International numbers use full E.164 format. Examples: US: 5555555555 E.164: +1155555555555

required_parameters.name: password
required_parameters.description: Password associated with phone number being entered in user/login.

api_list.name: group/get
api_list.description: Retreive details about an existing group. This call can be used to review the members of the group.

required_parameters.name: name
required_parameters.description: This is the name of the group that you would like to associate with a group of contacts when using group/save.

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: This is used to identify the type of group you wish to create. For now, please use 'Group'

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: textline
optional_parameters.description: If the group is being created within a landline or toll-free number than this parameter is required. This is the routing information for sending out the group message. Example format textline:/xxxxxxxxxx?carrier=xxx. After the :/ this is the logged in number's phone number. The carrier is equal to the carrier returned from user/get.

api_list.name: group/removemember
api_list.description: Remove a group member. This is useful if a group member has requested to opt-out of notifications.

required_parameters.name: group
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

required_parameters.name: member
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: message/read
api_list.description: Marks the given message as read in Zipwhip's database.

required_parameters.name: messages
required_parameters.description: The message ID being modified. In all cases the method will take multiple messages as parameters.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: conversation/delete
api_list.description: Deletes the conversation based on the provided conversation ID. It also deletes the associated messages.

required_parameters.name: fingerprint
required_parameters.description: The unique identifier for a conversation. This can be retrieved from a conversation/list.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: contact/save
api_list.description: Save details about the contact for the given phone number.

required_parameters.name: address
required_parameters.description: For US domestic use 10-digit number. For International numbers use full E.164 format. Examples: US: 5555555555 E.164: +1155555555555

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: city
optional_parameters.description: The name city where the contact resides.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email address of the contact being saved.

optional_parameters.name: firstName
optional_parameters.description: The first name of the contact being saved.

optional_parameters.name: lastName
optional_parameters.description: Notes about the contact, limit 255 characters.

optional_parameters.name: loc
optional_parameters.description: Notes about the contact, limit 255 characters.

optional_parameters.name: notes
optional_parameters.description: Notes about the contact, limit 255 characters.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: The state where the contact resides.

api_list.name: *message/send
api_list.description: Sends a message from the logged in user's phone number.

required_parameters.name: contacts
required_parameters.description: This is the contact ID that is return from contact/list. A contact ID is also part of the return from message/send.

required_parameters.name: body
required_parameters.description: The message body that you would like to send. This is a maximum of 160 ASCII characters or 140 Bytes.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: conversation/list
api_list.description: Deletes the conversation based on the provided conversation ID. It also deletes the associated messages.

required_parameters.name: fingerprint
required_parameters.description: The unique identifier for a conversation. This can be retrieved from a conversation/list.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: contact/list
api_list.description: This method returns all contacts associated with session provided.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: For paginated results iterate over the requested page(s) for all available content.

optional_parameters.name: pageSize
optional_parameters.description: Specify the number of results returned for a paginated method.

api_list.name: group/delete
api_list.description: Delete the group. This is similar to deleting a contact, no message objects will be affected by deleting the group.

required_parameters.name: address
required_parameters.description: For US domestic use 10-digit number. For International numbers use full E.164 format. Examples: US: 5555555555 E.164: +1155555555555

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

api_list.name: conversation/get
api_list.description: Retrieves conversation details and messages that specific to the conversation ID provided.

required_parameters.name: fingerprint
required_parameters.description: The unique identifier for a conversation. This can be retrieved from a conversation/list.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: Limit the number of elements returned when paging.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: When paging through content, this field is used to tell the controller what element to start at for the next page.

api_list.name: user/get
api_list.description: Provides information about the logged in user or account associated with sessionKey passed in.

required_parameters.name: session
required_parameters.description: This is the sessionKey that is returned from user/login. sessionKeys do not expire. Because of this, it is recommended that you do a single user/login and then save the sessionKey locally for future web calls.
